1.name: M
1.description: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

2.name: City Lights
2.description: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

3.name: Consolation Marriage
3.description: In prohibition-era Manhattan, shopkeeper Mary Brown loses Aubrey, her childhood sweetheart, when he marries a rich woman. Reporter Steve "Rollo" Porter has lost -his- childhood sweetheart, ...                See full summary »

4.name: Hell Divers
4.description: Story of rivalry between 2 Navy aircrewmen on and off duty.

5.name: Dracula
5.description: The ancient vampire Count Dracula arrives in England and begins to prey upon the virtuous young Mina.

6.name: Frankenstein
6.description: An obsessed scientist assembles a living being from parts of exhumed corpses.

7.name: Guilty Hands
7.description: A district attorney commits the perfect murder when he kills his daughter's womanizing fiancé and then tries framing the fiancé's lover.

8.name: Blonde Crazy
8.description: The adventures of an egoistic con man and his glamorous accomplice.

9.name: Laughing Sinners
9.description: Cabaret performer Ivy Stevens in an affair with a low-rent traveling salesman is dumped in a 'Dear Jane' letter and finds solace in joining the Salvation Army.

10.name: Dance, Fools, Dance
10.description: After the death of her father and loss of the family fortune, Bonnie gets a job as a cub reporter while her brother becomes involved in bootlegging.

11.name: Mata Hari
11.description: A semi-fictionalized account of the life of Mata Hari, an exotic dancer who was accused of spying for Germany during World War I.

12.name: The Public Enemy
12.description: A young hoodlum rises up through the ranks of the Chicago underworld, even as a gangster's accidental death threatens to spark a bloody mob war.

13.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
13.description: Dr. Jekyll faces horrible consequences when he lets his dark side run wild with a potion that transforms him into the animalistic Mr. Hyde.

14.name: Susan Lenox (Her Fall and Rise)
14.description: Fleeing her cruel uncle and an arranged marriage Susan Lenox falls in love with a kind stranger but circumstances force her to become a woman of easy virtue.

15.name: Little Caesar
15.description: A small-time criminal moves to a big city to seek bigger fortune.

16.name: A Free Soul
16.description: An alcoholic lawyer who successfully defended a notorious gambler on a murder charge objects when his free-spirited daughter becomes romantically involved with him.

17.name: Cimarron
17.description: A newspaper editor settles in an Oklahoma boom town with his reluctant wife at the end of the nineteenth century.

18.name: Monkey Business
18.description: On a transatlantic crossing, The Marx Brothers get up to their usual antics and manage to annoy just about everyone on board the ship.

19.name: The Front Page
19.description: An investigative reporter sees an opportunity for the story of a lifetime when an accused murderer escapes hanging.

20.name: The Champ
20.description: An alcoholic ex-boxer struggles to provide a good living for his son.

21.name: Dishonored
21.description: The Austrian Secret Service sends its most seductive agent to spy on the Russians.

22.name: Mädchen in Uniform
22.description: At an all-girls boarding school, Manuela falls in love with a teacher, to terrific consequences.

23.name: The Maltese Falcon
23.description: A lovely dame with dangerous lies employs the services of a private detective, who is quickly caught up in the mystery and intrigue of a statuette known as the Maltese Falcon.

24.name: Possessed
24.description: An ambitious factory girl meets a handsome, wealthy lawyer, but he's interested in her as a mistress, not a wife.

25.name: Pardon Us
25.description: Two guys end up in prison after attempting to sell beer to a policeman during Prohibition.

26.name: Svengali
26.description: Through hypnotism and telepathic mind control, a sinister music maestro controls the singing voice, but not the heart, of the woman he loves.

27.name: Platinum Blonde
27.description: A young woman from a very rich family impulsively marries a reporter, but each assumes the other is the one whose lifestyle must change.

28.name: Night Nurse
28.description: A nurse enlists the help of a petty criminal to foil a sinister plot to murder two children.

29.name: À Nous la Liberté
29.description: Seeking better life, two convicts escape from prison.

30.name: La Chienne
30.description: A woman and her pimp exploit a painter for money.

31.name: The 3 Penny Opera
31.description: In London at the turn of the century, the bandit Mack the Knife marries Polly without the knowledge of her father, Peachum, the 'king of the beggars'.

32.name: Iron Man
32.description: Prizefighter Mason loses his opening fight so wife Rose leaves him for Hollywood. Without her around Mason trains and starts winning. Rose comes back and wants Mason to dump his manager Regan and replace him with her secret lover Lewis.

33.name: The Smiling Lieutenant
33.description: An amorous lieutenant is forced to marry a socially awkward princess, though he tries to keep his violin-playing girlfriend on the side.

34.name: The Black Camel
34.description: The unsolved murder of a Hollywood actor several years earlier and an enigmatic psychic are the keys to help Charlie solve the Honolulu stabbing death of a beautiful actress.

35.name: Arrowsmith
35.description: Based on Sinclair Lewis's novel "Arrowsmith". A medical researcher is sent to a plague outbreak, where he has to decide priorities for the use of a vaccine.

36.name: The Skin Game
36.description: An old traditional family and a modern family battle over land in a small English village and almost destroy each other.

37.name: Trader Horn
37.description: Two white traders in the darkest Africa of the 1870s find a missionary's daughter, who was captured as a child by a savage tribe and now worshiped as a goddess.

38.name: Bad Girl
38.description: A man and woman, skeptical about romance, nonetheless fall in love and are wed, but their lack of confidence in the opposite sex haunts their marriage.

39.name: Waterloo Bridge
39.description: A prostitute's self-loathing makes her reluctant to marry an idealistic soldier during World War One.

40.name: Tabu: A Story of the South Seas
40.description: On the South Pacific island of Bora Bora, a young couple's love is threatened when the tribal chief declares the girl a sacred virgin.

41.name: The Bad Sister
41.description: Marianne falls in love with a con artist who has a hidden agenda.

42.name: Le Million
42.description: An impoverished painter and his rival engage in a race across Paris to recover a jacket concealing a winning lottery ticket.

43.name: East of Shanghai
43.description: Believing that an unexpected inheritance will bring them happiness, a married couple instead finds their relationship strained to the breaking point.

44.name: The Secret 6
44.description: After rising bootlegger Slaughterhouse Scorpio eliminates his gangland competition, two reporters and a cabal of six businessmen work to expose him.

45.name: Fighting Caravans
45.description: A young frontier scout helps guide a freight wagon train across the country, fighting off Indians and evil traders, while his two crusty companions try and save him from falling in love.

46.name: Millie
46.description: Millie's life begins to crumble when she finds out her husband is having an affair.

47.name: Drácula
47.description: Centuries-old vampire Dracula preys upon the innocent Eva and her friends.

48.name: Smart Money
48.description: Immigrant Greek barber has uncommon skills in playing poker and soon rises in the seedy world of illegal gambling, but pretty blondes remain his Achilles' heel.

49.name: The Easiest Way
49.description: Growing up in a poor working-class family, Laura decides not to marry the boy-next-door and instead accepts wealthy, older Will Brockton's invitation to move in with him. After falling in ...                See full summary »

50.name: Street Scene
50.description: Twenty-four hours elapse on the stoop of a Hell's Kitchen tenement as a microcosm of the American melting pot interacts with each other during a summer heatwave.
